doc:
"Charles Hawtrey (actor born 1914)" 0 George Frederick Joffre Hartree (30 November 1914 – 27 October 1988), known as Charles Hawtrey, was an English comedy actor and musician. Beginning at an early age as a boy soprano, he made several records before moving on to radio. His later career encompassed the theatre (as both actor and director), the cinema (where he regularly appeared supporting Will Hay in the 1930s and 1940s in films such as The Ghost of St. Michael's), through the Carry On films, and television. George_Frederick_Joffre_Hartree ( 30_November_1914 – 27_October_1988 ) , known as Charles_Hawtrey , was an_English_comedy_actor_and_musician . Beginning at an_early_age as a_boy_soprano , he made several_records before moving on to radio .
